Barley is a more reliable crop than wheat, and was consequently the staple cereal for much of Greek antiquity, because it can tolerate a greater degree of drought. The critical minimum amount of precipitation during the growing season (roughly October—May) is around 200 mm for barley, 300 mm for wheat: P.L.J.
